data.title: The 45+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Small Forwards
data.meta_description: Over 100 sports fans have voted on the 45+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Small Forwards. Current Top 3: Mark Aguirre, Michael Finley, Shawn Marion
data.text:
Ranked By

1.1K votes

195 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Dallas Mavericks

Big fan of Dallas basketball? Then check out this list of Dallas Mavericks small forwards. It includes almost every small forward from throughout Dallas Mavericks history, including current small forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA small forwards of all time, the best Mavericks SFs include Mark Aguirre, Shawn Marion, Jamal Mashburn, and Michael Finley.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Dallas Mavericks starting SFs and backup SFs are Dorian Finney-Smith, Reggie Bullock, and Tim Hardaway Jr.

Who are the best small forwards in Dallas Mavericks history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Dallas Mavericks small forward of all time!

Most divisive: George McCloud

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 45+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Small Forwards

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 1981-1989

A dominant force during his tenure with the Mavericks, Mark Aguirre was drafted by the team with the first overall pick in 1981 and instantly became the cornerstone of the young franchise. Renowned for his scoring prowess and physicality, Aguirre led the team to multiple playoff appearances in the 80s and earned three NBA All-Star selections during his time in Dallas. His impressive statistics combined with his ability to elevate the Mavericks to new heights make him an unforgettable talent for the team's fans and historians alike.

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 1996-2005

Undoubtedly one of the Mavericks' all-time greats, Michael Finley first joined the team in 1996 through a trade and quickly made his mark as an explosive scorer and versatile defender. Known for his athleticism and ability to shoot from beyond the arc, Finley played an instrumental role in the resurgence of the franchise during the late 90s and early 2000s. A two-time NBA All-Star while on the team, his popularity with fans and impact on the court undeniably cements him as one of the best small forwards in Dallas Mavericks history.

Birthplace : Waukegan, Illinois, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Dallas Mavericks

Position : Small forward, Power forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2009-2014

Acquired by the Mavericks in 2009 as a free agent, Shawn Marion played an integral part in solidifying the team's position as a contender in the Western Conference. Known for his tenacious defense and unorthodox offensive game, Marion's versatility and athleticism made him a perfect fit for the team's fast-paced style of play. His most significant accomplishment with the Mavericks came in 2011 when he played a vital role in the team's championship run, earning him the distinction of being one of the best small forwards in Dallas Mavericks history.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Nationality : American

Position : Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 1993-1997

Drafted by the Mavericks with the fourth overall pick in 1993, Jamal Mashburn quickly emerged as a dynamic scorer and skilled playmaker, earning himself NBA All-Rookie First Team honors. His scoring ability, along with his exceptional ball-handling skills, made him a force to be reckoned with during his tenure in Dallas. Although injuries limited his time on the court, his impact on the team's success and reputation as an offensive juggernaut earn him a spot among the best small forwards in Mavericks history.

Birthplace : Daytona Beach, Florida

Nationality : American

Team : Toronto Raptors, New Jersey Nets, Orlando Magic, Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks

Position : Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2011-2014

Joining the Mavericks in 2011 as a free agent, Vince Carter quickly established himself as a valuable contributor off the bench with his veteran leadership and scoring touch. Despite being past his prime, Carter's trademark athleticism and highlight-reel dunks remained exciting for fans to witness during his time in Dallas. His consistent performances and impact on the team earned him the respect of Mavericks fans, making him a memorable small forward in the franchise's history.

Birthplace : Winston-Salem, North Carolina

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Utah Jazz

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2003-2010

Drafted by the Mavericks in 2003, Josh Howard quickly became a key contributor thanks to his defensive prowess and offensive versatility. An NBA All-Star and member of the NBA All-Rookie Second Team, Howard's consistent play and role in the team's successes during the mid-2000s secure his spot among the best small forwards in Mavericks history. His athleticism and ability to impact the game on both ends of the floor endeared him to fans during his tenure in Dallas.
